<h1 class="firstHeading mw-first-heading" id="firstHeading"><span class="mw-page-title-main">United Kingdom</span></h1>
<div class="vector-body" id="bodyContent">
<div class="noprint" id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
<div id="contentSub"></div>
<div id="contentSub2"></div>
<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
<div class="mw-body-content mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Country in north-west Europe</div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1033289096">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}</style><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">"UK" redirects here. For other uses, see <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/United_Kingdom_(disambiguation)" title="United Kingdom (disambiguation)">United Kingdom (disambiguation)</a> and <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/UK_(disambiguation)" title="UK (disambiguation)">UK (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">This article is about the country. Not to be confused with <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">Great Britain</a>, its largest island whose name is also <a href="/wiki/Synecdoche" title="Synecdoche">loosely applied to the whole country</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/11px-Increase2.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/17px-Increase2.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/22px-Increase2.svg.png 2x" title="Increase" width="11"/> $55,301<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IMFWEOUK_20-1"><a href="#cite_note-IMFWEOUK-20">[15]</a></sup> (<a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(PPP)_per_capita" title="List of countries by GDP (PPP) per capita">26th</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_product" title="Gross domestic product">GDP</a> <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886047488" class="ib-country-fake-li">• Total</div></th><td class="infobox-data"><img alt="Increase" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" decoding="async" height="11" href="#cite_note-IMFWEOUK-20">[15]</a></sup> (<a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">6th</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedbottomrow"><th title="List of countries by GDP (nominal) per capita">25th</a>)</td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Gini_coefficient" title="Gini coefficient">Gini</a> <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886047488" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><span class="nobold">(2019)</span></th><td class="infobox-data"><img alt="Negative increase" data-file-height="300" equality">33rd</a></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Human_Development_Index" title="Human Development Index">HDI</a> <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886047488" countries by Human Development Index">18th</a></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row">Currency</th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/Pound_sterling" title="Pound sterling">Pound sterling</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23"><a href="#cite_note-23">[f]</a></sup> (<a href="/wiki/ISO_4217" title="ISO 4217">GBP</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th class="infobox-data"><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-24"><a href="#cite_note-24">[g]</a></sup></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row">Date format</th><td class="infobox-data"><abbr title="day">dd</abbr>/<abbr title="month">mm</abbr>/<abbr title="year">yyyy</abbr><br/><abbr title="year">yyyy</abbr>-<abbr title="month">mm</abbr>-<abbr title="day">dd</abbr> (<a side</a></th><td class="infobox-data">left<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-25"><a href="#cite_note-25">[h]</a></sup></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="Telephone numbers in the United Kingdom">+44</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-26"><a href="#cite_note-26">[i]</a></sup></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a href="/wiki/ISO_3166" title="ISO 3166">ISO 3166 code</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/ISO_3166-2:GB" title="ISO 3166-2:GB">GB</a></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Country_code_top-level_domain" title="Country code top-level domain">Internet TLD</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/.uk" title=".uk">.uk</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-27"><a href="#cite_note-27">[j]</a></sup></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>The <b>United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland</b>, commonly known as the <b>United Kingdom</b> (<b>UK</b>) or <b>Britain</b>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28"><a href="#cite_note-28">[note 1]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-29"><a href="#cite_note-29">[18]</a></sup> is a <a href="/wiki/Sovereign_state" title="Sovereign state">sovereign country</a> in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>, off the north-western coast of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_mainland" title="European mainland">continental mainland</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-30"><a href="#cite_note-30">[19]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31"><a href="#cite_note-31">[20]</a></sup> It comprises <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">England</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wales" title="Wales">Wales</a> and <a href="/wiki/Northern_Ireland" title="Northern Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-page823_32-0"><a href="#cite_note-page823-32">[21]</a></sup> The United Kingdom includes the island of <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">Great Britain</a>, the north-eastern part of the island of <a href="/wiki/Ireland" title="Ireland">Ireland</a>, and many <a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="List of islands of the United Kingdom">smaller islands</a> within the <a href="/wiki/British_Isles" title="British Isles">British Isles</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33"><a href="#cite_note-33">[22]</a></sup> Northern Ireland shares <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Ireland%E2%80%93United_Kingdom_border" title="Republic of Ireland–United Kingdom border">a land border</a> with the <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Ireland" title="Republic of Ireland">Republic of Ireland</a>; otherwise, the United Kingdom is surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean, the <a href="/wiki/North_Sea" title="North Sea">North Sea</a>, the <a href="/wiki/English_Channel" title="English Channel">English Channel</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Celtic_Sea" title="Celtic Sea">Celtic Sea</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Irish_Sea" title="Irish Sea">Irish Sea</a>. The total area of the United Kingdom is 242,495 square kilometres (93,628 sq mi), with an estimated 2020 population of more than 67 million people.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pop_estimate_34-0"><a href="#cite_note-pop_estimate-34">[23]</a></sup>
</p><p>The United Kingdom is a <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_monarchy" title="Constitutional monarchy">constitutional monarchy</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Parliamentary_democracy" title="Parliamentary democracy">parliamentary democracy</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35"><a href="#cite_note-35">[note 2]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36"><a href="#cite_note-36">[24]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-37"><a href="#cite_note-37">[25]</a></sup> The capital and <a href="/wiki/List_of_urban_areas_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="List of urban areas in the United Kingdom">largest city</a> is <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a>, a global city and financial centre with a metropolitan area population of over 14 million. Other major cities include <a href="/wiki/Birmingham" title="Birmingham">Birmingham</a>, <a href="/wiki/Manchester" title="Manchester">Manchester</a>, <a href="/wiki/Glasgow" title="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>, <a href="/wiki/Liverpool" title="Liverpool">Liverpool</a> and <a href="/wiki/Leeds" title="Leeds">Leeds</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38"><a href="#cite_note-38">[26]</a></sup> Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland have their own <a href="/wiki/Devolution_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="Devolution in the United Kingdom">devolved governments</a>, each with varying powers.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-devoladmins_39-0"><a href="#cite_note-devoladmins-39">[27]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-40"><a href="#cite_note-40">[28]</a></sup>
</p><p>The United Kingdom has evolved from a series of annexations, unions and separations of constituent countries over several hundred years. The <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Union" title="Treaty of Union">Treaty of Union</a> between the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_England" title="Kingdom of England">Kingdom of England</a> (which included Wales, <a href="/wiki/Laws_in_Wales_Acts_1535_and_1542" title="Laws in Wales Acts 1535 and 1542">annexed in 1542</a>) and the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Scotland" title="Kingdom of Scotland">Kingdom of Scotland</a> in 1707 formed the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Great_Britain" title="Kingdom of Great Britain">Kingdom of Great Britain</a>. Its <a href="/wiki/Acts_of_Union_1800" title="Acts of Union 1800">union in 1801</a> with the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Ireland" title="Kingdom of Ireland">Kingdom of Ireland</a> created the <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom_of_Great_Britain_and_Ireland" title="United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland">United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland</a>. Most of Ireland seceded from the UK in 1922, leaving the present United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, which formally adopted that name in 1927.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-41"><a href="#cite_note-41">[note 3]</a></sup> The UK became the world's first <a href="/wiki/Industrialisation" title="Industrialisation">industrialised</a> country and was the world's <a href="/wiki/Foremost_power" title="Foremost power">foremost power</a> during the 19th and early 20th centuries.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-42"><a href="#cite_note-42">[29]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ferguson_43-0"><a href="#cite_note-ferguson-43">[30]</a></sup> In the 21st century, the UK retains considerable <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Economy of the United Kingdom">economic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Culture of the United Kingdom">cultural</a>, <a href="/wiki/British_Armed_Forces" title="British Armed Forces">military</a>, <a href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="Science and technology in the United Kingdom">scientific, technological</a> and <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Politics of the United Kingdom">political</a> influence.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-44"><a href="#cite_note-44">[31]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-David_M._McCourt_45-0"><a href="#cite_note-David_M._McCourt-45">[32]</a></sup>
</p><p>The nearby <a href="/wiki/Isle_of_Man" title="Isle of Man">Isle of Man</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bailiwick_of_Guernsey" title="Bailiwick of Guernsey">Guernsey</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jersey" title="Jersey">Jersey</a> are not part of the UK, being <a href="/wiki/Crown_Dependencies" title="Crown Dependencies">Crown Dependencies</a> with the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/British_Government" title="British Government">British Government</a> responsible for defence and international representation.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-46"><a href="#cite_note-46">[33]</a></sup> There are also 14 <a href="/wiki/British_Overseas_Territories" title="British Overseas Territories">British Overseas Territories</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-overseasterrirories_47-0"><a href="#cite_note-overseasterrirories-47">[34]</a></sup> the last remnants of the <a href="/wiki/British_Empire" title="British Empire">British Empire</a> which, at its height in the 1920s, encompassed almost a quarter of the world's landmass and a third of the world's population, and was the <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_empires#Empires_at_their_greatest_extent" title="List of largest empires">largest empire in history</a>. British influence can be observed in the language, culture and the legal and political systems of many of its <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_that_have_gained_independence_from_the_United_Kingdom" title="List of countries that have gained independence from the United Kingdom">former colonies</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-48"><a href="#cite_note-48">[35]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEFerguson2004307_49-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFerguson2004307-49">[36]</a></sup>
</p><p>The United Kingdom has the world's <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">sixth-largest economy by nominal gross domestic product</a> (GDP), and the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(PPP)" title="List of countries by GDP (PPP)">eighth-largest by purchasing power parity</a>. It has a high-income economy and a very high <a href="/wiki/Human_Development_Index" title="Human Development Index">Human Development Index</a> rating, ranking 18th in the world. It also performs well in <a href="/wiki/International_rankings_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="International rankings of the United Kingdom">international rankings</a> of <a href="/wiki/Education_Index" title="Education Index">education</a>, <a href="/wiki/Healthcare_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="Healthcare in the United Kingdom">healthcare</a>, <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">life expectancy</a> and human development.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-50"><a href="#cite_note-50">[37]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-51"><a href="#cite_note-51">[38]</a></sup> It is a recognised <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nuclear_state" title="Nuclear state">nuclear state</a> and is ranked <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_military_expenditures" title="List of countries by military expenditures">fourth globally in military expenditure</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-52"><a href="#cite_note-52">[39]</a></sup> It has been a <a href="/wiki/Permanent_members_of_the_United_Nations_Security_Council" title="Permanent members of the United Nations Security Council">permanent member</a> of the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council" title="United Nations Security Council">United Nations Security Council</a> since its first session in 1946.
</p><p>The United Kingdom is a member of the <a href="/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations" title="Commonwealth of Nations">Commonwealth of Nations</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Europe" title="Council of Europe">Council of Europe</a>, the <a href="/wiki/G7" title="G7">G7</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Group_of_Ten_(economics)" title="Group of Ten (economics)">Group of Ten</a>, the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/G-20_major_economies" title="G-20 major economies">G20</a>, the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a>, <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">NATO</a>, <a href="/wiki/AUKUS" title="AUKUS">AUKUS</a>, the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Organisation_for_Economic_Co-operation_and_Development" title="Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development">Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development</a> (OECD), <a href="/wiki/Interpol" title="Interpol">Interpol</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/World_Trade_Organization" title="World Trade Organization">World Trade Organization</a> (WTO). It was a member state of the <a href="/wiki/European_Communities" title="European Communities">European Communities</a> (EC) and its successor, the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> (EU), from its <a href="/wiki/Accession_of_the_United_Kingdom_to_the_European_Communities" title="Accession of the United Kingdom to the European Communities">accession in 1973</a> until its <a href="/wiki/Brexit" title="Brexit">withdrawal in 2020</a> following <a href="/wiki/2016_United_Kingdom_European_Union_membership_referendum" title="2016 United Kingdom European Union membership referendum">a referendum</a> held in 2016.
</p>
<div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<ul>
