</li>
<li id="cite_note-44"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-44">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFT.V._PaulJames_J._WirtzMichel_Fortmann2005">T.V. Paul; James J. Wirtz; Michel Fortmann (2005). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com/books?id=9jy28vBqscQC&amp;pg=PA59&amp;dq=" rel="nofollow">"Great+power" <i>Balance of Power</i></a>. State University of New York Press. pp. 59, 282. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7914-6401-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7914-6401-4"><bdi>978-0-7914-6401-4</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Balance+of+Power&amp;rft.pages=59%2C+282&amp;rft.pub=State+University+of+New+York+Press&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7914-6401-4&amp;rft.au=T.V.+Paul&amp;rft.au=James+J.+Wirtz&amp;rft.au=Michel+Fortmann&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D9jy28vBqscQC%26pg%3DPA59%26dq%3D%22Great%2Bpower%22&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span> <i>Accordingly, the great powers after the Cold War are Britain, China, France, Germany, Japan, Russia and the United States</i> p. 59</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-David_M._McCourt-45"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-David_M._McCourt_45-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMcCourt2014">McCourt, David (2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=lwpOnwEACAAJ&amp;q=Britain+and+World+Power+Since+1945:+Constructing+a+Nation%27s+Role+in+International+Politics" rel="nofollow"><i>Britain and World Power Since 1945: Constructing a Nation's Role in International Politics</i></a>. United States: <a href="/wiki/University_of_Michigan_Press" title="University of Michigan Press">University of Michigan Press</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-472-07221-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-472-07221-7"><bdi>978-0-472-07221-7</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Britain+and+World+Power+Since+1945%3A+Constructing+a+Nation%27s+Role+in+International+Politics&amp;rft.place=United+States&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Michigan+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-472-07221-7&amp;rft.aulast=McCourt&amp;rft.aufirst=David&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DlwpOnwEACAAJ%26q%3DBritain%2Band%2BWorld%2BPower%2BSince%2B1945%3A%2BConstructing%2Ba%2BNation%2527s%2BRole%2Bin%2BInternational%2BPolitics&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-46"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-46">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20121015000000/http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Governmentcitizensandrights/LivingintheUK/DG_10012517" rel="nofollow">"Key facts about the United Kingdom"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Directgov" title="Directgov">Directgov</a>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Governmentcitizensandrights/LivingintheUK/DG_10012517" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 15 October 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 March</span> 2015</span>. <q>The full title of this country is 'the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland'. Great Britain is made up of England, Scotland and Wales. The United Kingdom (UK) is made up of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. 'Britain' is used informally, usually meaning the United Kingdom.<br/> The Channel Islands and the Isle of Man are not part of the UK.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Key+facts+about+the+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.pub=Directgov&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.direct.gov.uk%2Fen%2FGovernmentcitizensandrights%2FLivingintheUK%2FDG_10012517&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>

Abingdon: Routledge. p. 165. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-415-56301-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-415-56301-7"><bdi>978-0-415-56301-7</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Constitutional+%26+Administrative+Law&amp;rft.place=Abingdon&amp;rft.pages=165&amp;rft.edition=8th&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-415-56301-7&amp;rft.au=Barnett%2C+Hilaire&amp;rft.au=Jago%2C+Robert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DLYc1tSYonrQC%26pg%3DPA165&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-name-61"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-name_61-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"After the political union of England and Scotland in 1707, the nation's official name became 'Great Britain'", <i>The American Pageant, Volume 1</i>, Cengage Learning (2012).</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-name2-62"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-name2_62-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"From 1707 until 1801 <i>Great Britain</i> was the official designation of the kingdoms of England and Scotland". <i>The Standard Reference Work: For the Home, School and Library, Volume 3</i>, Harold Melvin Stanford (1921)</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-name3-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-name3_63-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"In 1707, on the union with Scotland, 'Great Britain' became the official name of the British Kingdom, and so continued until the union with Ireland in 1801". <i>United States Congressional serial set, Issue 10; Issue 3265</i> (1895).</span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-alphabeticalNI1-66"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-alphabeticalNI1_66-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs2" id="CITEREFS._DunnH._Dawson2000">S. Dunn; H. Dawson (2000), <i>An Alphabetical Listing of Word, Name and Place in Northern Ireland and the Living Language of Conflict</i>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lewiston,_New_York" title="Lewiston, New York">Lewiston, New York</a>: <a href="/wiki/Edwin_Mellen_Press" title="Edwin Mellen Press">Edwin Mellen Press</a>, <q>One specific problem – in both general and particular senses – is to know what to call Northern Ireland itself: in the general sense, it is not a country, or a province, or a state – although some refer to it contemptuously as a statelet: the least controversial word appears to be jurisdiction, but this might change.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=An+Alphabetical+Listing+of+Word%2C+Name+and+Place+in+Northern+Ireland+and+the+Living+Language+of+Conflict&amp;rft.place=Lewiston%2C+New+York&amp;rft.pub=Edwin+Mellen+Press&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.au=S.+Dunn&amp;rft.au=H.+Dawson&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>

UK Government.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=www.gov.uk&amp;rft.atitle=A+to+Z+%E2%80%93+Style+guide&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gov.uk%2Fguidance%2Fstyle-guide%2Fa-to-z-of-gov-uk-style%23B&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-PCGN-uk-guide-82"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-PCGN-uk-guide_82-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PCGN-uk-guide_82-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PCGN-uk-guide_82-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFPermanent_Committee_on_Geographical_Names">Permanent Committee on Geographical Names. <a class="external text" href="https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/toponymic-guidelines" rel="nofollow">"Toponymic guidelines for the United Kingdom"</a>. <i>gov.uk</i>. UK Government.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=gov.uk&amp;rft.atitle=Toponymic+guidelines+for+the+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.au=Permanent+Committee+on+Geographical+Names&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gov.uk%2Fgovernment%2Fpublications%2Ftoponymic-guidelines&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Edgerton2012-145"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Edgerton2012_145-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Edgerton2012_145-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFEdgerton2012">Edgerton, David (2012). <a class="external text" href="https://www.penguin.co.uk/books/55731/britain-s-war-machine/9780141026107.html" rel="nofollow"><i>Britain's War Machine</i></a>. <i>www.penguin.co.uk</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-148"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-148">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180125021103/http://rooseveltinstitute.org/special-relationship-between-great-britain-and-united-states-began-fdr/" rel="nofollow">"The "Special Relationship" between Great Britain and the United States Began with FDR"</a>. Roosevelt Institute. 22 July 2010. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://rooseveltinstitute.org/special-relationship-between-great-britain-and-united-states-began-fdr/" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 25 January 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 January</span> 2018</span>. <q>and the joint efforts of both powers to create a new post-war strategic and economic order through the drafting of the Atlantic Charter; the establishment of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank; and the creation of the United Nations.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+%22Special+Relationship%22+between+Great+Britain+and+the+United+States+Began+with+FDR&amp;rft.pub=Roosevelt+Institute&amp;rft.date=2010-07-22&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Frooseveltinstitute.org%2Fspecial-relationship-between-great-britain-and-united-states-began-fdr%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-149"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-149">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation pressrelease cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/the-press-office/2016/04/22/remarks-president-obama-and-prime-minister-cameron-joint-press" rel="nofollow">"Remarks by the President Obama and Prime Minister Cameron in Joint Press Conference"</a> (Press release). Some of the heirs to Ireland's violent traditions refused to give up their inheritance." <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHolland1999">Holland, Jack (1999). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/hopeagainsthisto00holl/page/221" rel="nofollow"><i>Hope against History: The Course of Conflict in Northern Ireland</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-factbook-176"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-factbook_176-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-factbook_176-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-factbook_176-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-factbook_176-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-factbook_176-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/united-kingdom/" rel="nofollow">"United Kingdom"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-Atlapedia-177"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Atlapedia_177-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Atlapedia_177-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Atlapedia_177-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Atlapedia_177-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFLatimer_Clarke_Corporation_Pty_Ltd">Latimer Clarke Corporation Pty Ltd. <a class="external text" href="http://www.atlapedia.com/online/countries/unitedki.htm" rel="nofollow">"United Kingdom – Atlapedia Online"</a>. <li id="cite_note-178"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-178">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFROG_Learning_Team2002">ROG Learning Team (23 August 2002). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20151107023957/http://www.rmg.co.uk/explore/astronomy-and-time/astronomy-facts/history/the-prime-meridian-at-greenwich" rel="nofollow">"The Prime Meridian at Greenwich"</a>. <i>Royal Museums Greenwich</i>. Royal Museums Greenwich. <li id="cite_note-FLII-Supplementary-191"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLII-Supplementary_191-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGranthamDuncanEvansJones2020">Grantham, H. S.;  et al. (2020). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7723057" rel="nofollow">"Anthropogenic modification of forests means only 40% of remaining forests have high ecosystem integrity – Supplementary Material"</a>. <i>Nature Communications</i>. <b>11</b> (1): 5978. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a <li id="cite_note-227"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-227">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110222124635/http://www.psa.ac.uk/2007/pps/Bennie.pdf" rel="nofollow">"STV in Scotland: Local Government Elections 2007"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Political Studies Association. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.psa.ac.uk/2007/pps/Bennie.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 22 February 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 August</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=STV+in+Scotland%3A+Local+Government+Elections+2007&amp;rft.pub=Political+Studies+Association&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.psa.ac.uk%2F2007%2Fpps%2FBennie.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-unitary-228"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-unitary_228-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-unitary_228-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150310210146/http://gov.wales/topics/localgovernment/local-authorities/?lang=en" rel="nofollow">"Unitary authorities"</a>. <li id="cite_note-bbcnews250313-233"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-bbcnews250313_233-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-21920010" rel="nofollow">"England-only laws 'need majority from English MPs'<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>. 25 March 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-234"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-234">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/events/scotland_99/the_scottish_parliament/310036.stm" rel="nofollow">"Scotland's Parliament – powers and structures"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>. 8 April 1999<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 October</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Scotland%27s+Parliament+%E2%80%93+powers+and+structures&amp;rft.date=1999-04-08&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fevents%2Fscotland_99%2Fthe_scottish_parliament%2F310036.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Keating21-235"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Keating21_235-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFKeating2021">Keating, Michael (2 February 2021). "Taking back control? Brexit and the territorial constitution of the United Kingdom". <i><a href="/wiki/Journal_of_European_Public_Policy" title="Journal of European Public Policy">Journal of European Public Policy</a></i>. Abingdon: <a href="/wiki/Taylor_%26_Francis" title="Taylor &amp; Francis">Taylor &amp; Francis</a>. <b>28</b> (4): 6–7. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F13501763.2021.1876156" rel="nofollow">10.1080/13501763.2021.1876156</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hdl_(identifier)" title="Hdl (identifier)">hdl</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//hdl.handle.net/1814%2F70296" rel="nofollow">1814/70296</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:234066376" rel="nofollow">234066376</a>. <q>The UK Internal Market Act gives ministers sweeping powers to enforce mutual recognition and non-discrimination across the four jurisdictions. Existing differences and some social and health matters are exempted but these are much less extensive than the exemptions permitted under the EU Internal Market provisions. Only after an amendment in the House of Lords, the Bill was amended to provide a weak and non-binding consent mechanism for amendments (equivalent to the Sewel Convention) to the list of exemptions. The result is that, while the devolved governments retain regulatory competences, these are undermined by the fact that goods and services originating in, or imported into, England can be marketed anywhere.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+European+Public+Policy&amp;rft.atitle=Taking+back+control%3F+Brexit+and+the+territorial+constitution+of+the+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.volume=28&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.pages=6-7&amp;rft.date=2021-02-02&amp;rft_id=info%3Ahdl%2F1814%2F70296&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A234066376%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F13501763.2021.1876156&amp;rft.aulast=Keating&amp;rft.aufirst=Michael&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-KenMcEw21-236"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-KenMcEw21_236-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFKennyMcEwen2021"><a href="/wiki/Michael_Kenny_(political_scientist)" title="Michael Kenny (political scientist)">Kenny, Michael</a>; <a href="/wiki/Nicola_McEwen" title="Nicola McEwen">McEwen, Nicola</a> (1 March 2021). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1177%2F20419058211000996" rel="nofollow">"Intergovernmental Relations and the Crisis of the Union"</a>. <i>Political Insight</i>. <a href="/wiki/SAGE_Publishing" title="SAGE Publishing">SAGE Publishing</a>. <b>12</b> (1): 12–15. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1177%2F20419058211000996" rel="nofollow">10.1177/20419058211000996</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:232050477" rel="nofollow">232050477</a>. <q>That phase of joint working was significantly damaged by the UK Internal Market Act, pushed through by the Johnson government in December 2020...the Act diminishes the authority of the devolved institutions, and was vehemently opposed by them.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Political+Insight&amp;rft.atitle=Intergovernmental+Relations+and+the+Crisis+of+the+Union&amp;rft.volume=12&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=12-15&amp;rft.date=2021-03-01&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1177%2F20419058211000996&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A232050477%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=Kenny&amp;rft.aufirst=Michael&amp;rft.au=McEwen%2C+Nicola&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1177%252F20419058211000996&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-WolffeDevol-237"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-WolffeDevol_237-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFWolffe2021"><a href="/wiki/James_Wolffe" title="James Wolffe">Wolffe, W James</a> (7 April 2021). <a class="external text" href="https://academic.oup.com/slr/advance-article/doi/10.1093/slr/hmab003/6213886" rel="nofollow">"Devolution and the Statute Book"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Statute_Law_Review" title="Statute Law Review">Statute Law Review</a></i>. Oxford: <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Fslr%2Fhmab003" rel="nofollow">10.1093/slr/hmab003</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 April</span> 2021</span>. <q>the Internal Market Bill—a Bill that contains provisions which, if enacted, would significantly constrain, both legally and as a matter of practicality, the exercise by the devolved legislatures of their legislative competence; provisions that would be significantly more restrictive of the powers of the Scottish Parliament than either EU law or Articles 4 and 6 of the Acts of the Union...The UK Parliament passed the European Union (Withdrawal Agreement) Act 2020 and the Internal Market Act 2020 notwithstanding that, in each case, all three of the devolved legislatures had withheld consent.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Statute+Law+Review&amp;rft.atitle=Devolution+and+the+Statute+Book&amp;rft.date=2021-04-07&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Fslr%2Fhmab003&amp;rft.aulast=Wolffe&amp;rft.aufirst=W+James&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Facademic.oup.com%2Fslr%2Fadvance-article%2Fdoi%2F10.1093%2Fslr%2Fhmab003%2F6213886&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Wincott21-238"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Wincott21_238-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFWincottMurrayDavies2021"><a href="/wiki/Daniel_Wincott" title="Daniel Wincott">Wincott, Daniel</a>; Murray, C. R. G.; Davies, Gregory (17 May 2021). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F21622671.2021.1921613" rel="nofollow">"The Anglo-British imaginary and the rebuilding of the UK's territorial constitution after Brexit: unitary state or union state?"</a>. <i>Territory, Politics, Governance</i>. Abingdon/Brighton: <a href="/wiki/Taylor_%26_Francis" title="Taylor &amp; Francis">Taylor &amp; Francis</a>; <a href="/wiki/Regional_Studies_Association" title="Regional Studies Association">Regional Studies Association</a>. <b>10</b> (5): 696–713. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F21622671.2021.1921613" rel="nofollow">10.1080/21622671.2021.1921613</a></span>. <q>Taken as a whole, the Internal Market Act imposes greater restrictions upon the competences of the devolved institutions than the provisions of the EU Single Market which it replaced, in spite of pledges to use common frameworks to address these issues. <a href="/wiki/David_Hope,_Baron_Hope_of_Craighead" title="David Hope, Baron Hope of Craighead">Lord Hope</a>, responsible for many of the leading judgments relating to the first two decades of devolution, regarded the legislation's terms as deliberately confrontational: 'this Parliament can do what it likes, but a different approach is essential if the union is to hold together'.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Territory%2C+Politics%2C+Governance&amp;rft.atitle=The+Anglo-British+imaginary+and+the+rebuilding+of+the+UK%27s+territorial+constitution+after+Brexit%3A+unitary+state+or+union+state%3F&amp;rft.volume=10&amp;rft.issue=5&amp;rft.pages=696-713&amp;rft.date=2021-05-17&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F21622671.2021.1921613&amp;rft.aulast=Wincott&amp;rft.aufirst=Daniel&amp;rft.au=Murray%2C+C.+R.+G.&amp;rft.au=Davies%2C+Gregory&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1080%252F21622671.2021.1921613&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-DouganMcEwen20-239"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-DouganMcEwen20_239-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation report cs1" id="CITEREFDouganHaywardHuntMcEwen2020"><a href="/wiki/Michael_Dougan" title="Michael Dougan">Dougan, Michael</a>; <a href="/wiki/Katy_Hayward" title="Katy Hayward">Hayward, Katy</a>; Hunt, Jo; <a href="/wiki/Nicola_McEwen" title="Nicola McEwen">McEwen, Nicola</a>; McHarg, Aileen; <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Wincott" title="Daniel Wincott">Wincott, Daniel</a> (2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.centreonconstitutionalchange.ac.uk/publications/uk-and-internal-market-devolution-and-union" rel="nofollow">UK and the Internal Market, Devolution and the Union</a>. Centre on Constitutional Change (Report). <a href="/wiki/University_of_Edinburgh" title="University of Edinburgh">University of Edinburgh</a>; <a href="/wiki/University_of_Aberdeen" title="University of Aberdeen">University of Aberdeen</a>. pp. 2–3<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 October</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=report&amp;rft.btitle=UK+and+the+Internal+Market%2C+Devolution+and+the+Union&amp;rft.pages=2-3&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Edinburgh%3B+University+of+Aberdeen&amp;rft.date=2020&amp;rft.aulast=Dougan&amp;rft.aufirst=Michael&amp;rft.au=Hayward%2C+Katy&amp;rft.au=Hunt%2C+Jo&amp;rft.au=McEwen%2C+Nicola&amp;rft.au=McHarg%2C+Aileen&amp;rft.au=Wincott%2C+Daniel&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.centreonconstitutionalchange.ac.uk%2Fpublications%2Fuk-and-internal-market-devolution-and-union&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Dougan20Brief-240"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Dougan20Brief_240-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation report cs1" id="CITEREFDougan2020"><a href="/wiki/Michael_Dougan" title="Michael Dougan">Dougan, Michael</a> (2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.liverpool.ac.uk/media/livacuk/law/2-research/eull/UKIM,Briefing,Paper,-,Prof,Michael,Dougan,15,September,2020.pdf" rel="nofollow">Briefing Paper. United Kingdom Internal Market Bill: Implications for Devolution</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (Report). Liverpool: <a href="/wiki/University_of_Liverpool" title="University of Liverpool">University of Liverpool</a>. pp. 4–5<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 October</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=report&amp;rft.btitle=Briefing+Paper.+United+Kingdom+Internal+Market+Bill%3A+Implications+for+Devolution&amp;rft.place=Liverpool&amp;rft.pages=4-5&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Liverpool&amp;rft.date=2020&amp;rft.aulast=Dougan&amp;rft.aufirst=Michael&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.liverpool.ac.uk%2Fmedia%2Flivacuk%2Flaw%2F2-research%2Feull%2FUKIM%2CBriefing%2CPaper%2C-%2CProf%2CMichael%2CDougan%2C15%2CSeptember%2C2020.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-UKIM-241"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-UKIM_241-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-UKIM_241-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Keating21_235-0"><a href="#cite_note-Keating21-235">[221]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-KenMcEw21_236-0"><a href="#cite_note-KenMcEw21-236">[222]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WolffeDevol_237-0"><a href="#cite_note-WolffeDevol-237">[223]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wincott21_238-0"><a href="#cite_note-Wincott21-238">[224]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DouganMcEwen20_239-0"><a href="#cite_note-DouganMcEwen20-239">[225]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dougan20Brief_240-0"><a href="#cite_note-Dougan20Brief-240">[226]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-242"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-242">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-politics-52544137" rel="nofollow">"Welsh assembly renamed Senedd Cymru/Welsh Parliament", <i>BBC News</i>, 6 May 2020</a>. Retrieved 6 May 2020</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-243"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-243">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/events/wales_99/the_welsh_assembly/309033.stm" rel="nofollow">"Structure and powers of the Assembly"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>. 9 April 1999<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 October</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Structure+and+powers+of+the+Assembly&amp;rft.date=1999-04-09&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fevents%2Fwales_99%2Fthe_welsh_assembly%2F309033.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-northernireland1-244"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-northernireland1_244-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.northernireland.gov.uk/topics/your-executive" rel="nofollow">"Your Executive"</a>. Northern Ireland Executive. 25 September 2015.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Your+Executive&amp;rft.pub=Northern+Ireland+Executive&amp;rft.date=2015-09-25&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.northernireland.gov.uk%2Ftopics%2Fyour-executive&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-245"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-245">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBurrows1999">Burrows, N. (1999). "Unfinished Business: The Scotland Act 1998". <i>The Modern Law Review</i>. <b>62</b> (2): 241–260 [p. 249]. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1111%2F1468-2230.00203" rel="nofollow">10.1111/1468-2230.00203</a>. <q>The UK Parliament is sovereign and the Scottish Parliament is subordinate. The White Paper had indicated that this was to be the approach taken in the legislation. The Scottish Parliament is not to be seen as a reflection of the settled will of the people of Scotland or of popular sovereignty but as a reflection of its subordination to a higher legal authority. Following the logic of this argument, the power of the Scottish Parliament to legislate can be withdrawn or overridden...</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Modern+Law+Review&amp;rft.atitle=Unfinished+Business%3A+The+Scotland+Act+1998&amp;rft.volume=62&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=241-260+p.+249&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1111%2F1468-2230.00203&amp;rft.aulast=Burrows&amp;rft.aufirst=N.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-246"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-246">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFElliot2004">Elliot, M. (2004). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Ficon%2F2.3.545" rel="nofollow">"United Kingdom: Parliamentary sovereignty under pressure"</a>. <i>International Journal of Constitutional Law</i>. <b>2</b> (3): 545–627, 553–554. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Ficon%2F2.3.545" rel="nofollow">10.1093/icon/2.3.545</a></span>. <q>Notwithstanding substantial differences among the schemes, an important common factor is that the UK Parliament has not renounced legislative sovereignty in relation to the three nations concerned. For example, the Scottish Parliament is empowered to enact primary legislation on all matters, save those in relation to which competence is explicitly denied ... but this power to legislate on what may be termed "devolved matters" is concurrent with the Westminster Parliament's general power to legislate for Scotland on any matter at all, including devolved matters ... In theory, therefore, Westminster may legislate on Scottish devolved matters whenever it chooses...</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Constitutional+Law&amp;rft.atitle=United+Kingdom%3A+Parliamentary+sovereignty+under+pressure&amp;rft.volume=2&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=545-627%2C+553-554&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Ficon%2F2.3.545&amp;rft.aulast=Elliot&amp;rft.aufirst=M.&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1093%252Ficon%252F2.3.545&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-247"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-247">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFWalker2010">Walker, G. (2010). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1086%2F644536" rel="nofollow">"Scotland, Northern Ireland, and Devolution, 1945–1979"</a>. <i>Journal of British Studies</i>. <b>39</b> (1): 117–142. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1086%2F644536" rel="nofollow">10.1086/644536</a></span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+British+Studies&amp;rft.atitle=Scotland%2C+Northern+Ireland%2C+and+Devolution%2C+1945%E2%80%931979&amp;rft.volume=39&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=117-142&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1086%2F644536&amp;rft.aulast=Walker&amp;rft.aufirst=G.&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1086%252F644536&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-248"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-248">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGamble2006">Gamble, A. (2006). "The Constitutional Revolution in the United Kingdom". <i>Publius</i>. <b>36</b> (1): 19–35 [p. 29]. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Fpublius%2Fpjj011" rel="nofollow">10.1093/publius/pjj011</a>. <q>The British parliament has the power to abolish the Scottish parliament and the Welsh assembly by a simple majority vote in both houses, but since both were sanctioned by referenda, it would be politically difficult to abolish them without the sanction of a further vote by the people. In this way, several of the constitutional measures introduced by the Blair government appear to be entrenched and not subject to a simple exercise of parliamentary sovereignty at Westminster.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Publius&amp;rft.atitle=The+Constitutional+Revolution+in+the+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.volume=36&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=19-35+p.+29&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Fpublius%2Fpjj011&amp;rft.aulast=Gamble&amp;rft.aufirst=A.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-249"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-249">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFMeehan1999">Meehan, E. (1999). "The Belfast Agreement – Its Distinctiveness and Points of Cross-Fertilization in the UK's Devolution Programme". <i>Parliamentary Affairs</i>. <b>52</b> (1): 19–31 [p. 23]. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Fpa%2F52.1.19" rel="nofollow">10.1093/pa/52.1.19</a>. <q>[T]he distinctive involvement of two governments in the Northern Irish problem means that Northern Ireland's new arrangements rest upon an intergovernmental agreement. If this can be equated with a treaty, it could be argued that the forthcoming distribution of power between Westminster and Belfast has similarities with divisions specified in the written constitutions of federal states...Although the Agreement makes the general proviso that Westminster's 'powers to make legislation for Northern Ireland' remains 'unaffected', without an explicit categorical reference to reserved matters, it may be more difficult than in Scotland or Wales for devolved powers to be repatriated. The retraction of devolved powers would not merely entail consultation in Northern Ireland backed implicitly by the absolute power of parliamentary sovereignty but also the renegotiation of an intergovernmental agreement.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Parliamentary+Affairs&amp;rft.atitle=The+Belfast+Agreement+%E2%80%93+Its+Distinctiveness+and+Points+of+Cross-Fertilization+in+the+UK%27s+Devolution+Programme&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=19-31+p.+23&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Fpa%2F52.1.19&amp;rft.aulast=Meehan&amp;rft.aufirst=E.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-250"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-250">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.cibc.com/ca/pwm-global/locations/caribbean/cayman-islands.html" rel="nofollow">"CIBC PWM Global – Introduction to The Cayman Islands"</a>. <li id="cite_note-255"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-255">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/overseas-territories" rel="nofollow"><i>Overseas Territories The Ministry of Defence's Contribution</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-256"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-256">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200627185942/https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmselect/cmfaff/1464/1464.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Global Britain and the British Overseas Territories: Resetting the relationship</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. House of Commons Foreign Affairs Committee. 13 February 2019. p. 5. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 April</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Global+Britain+and+the+British+Overseas+Territories%3A+Resetting+the+relationship&amp;rft.pages=5&amp;rft.pub=House+of+Commons+Foreign+Affairs+Committee&amp;rft.date=2019-02-13&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fpublications.parliament.uk%2Fpa%2Fcm201719%2Fcmselect%2Fcmfaff%2F1464%2F1464.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-257"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-257">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.seaaroundus.org/data/#/eez" rel="nofollow">"Sea Around Us | Fisheries, Ecosystems and Biodiversity"</a>. <i>www.seaaroundus.org</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 January</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=www.seaaroundus.org&amp;rft.atitle=Sea+Around+Us+%7C+Fisheries%2C+Ecosystems+and+Biodiversity&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.seaaroundus.org%2Fdata%2F%23%2Feez&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-313"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-313">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161014061717/http://www.smmt.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/SMMT-Motor-Industry-Facts-2016.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Motor Industry Facts 2016"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders. 2016. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 March</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=United+Kingdom+%E2%80%93+Quick+Facts+Energy+Overview&amp;rft.pub=U.S.+Energy+Information+Administration&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.eia.doe.gov%2Femeu%2Fcabs%2FUnited_Kingdom%2FProfile.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Costello-412"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Costello_412-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCostello2001">Costello, Ray (2001). <i>Black Liverpool: The Early History of Britain's Oldest Black Community 1730–1918</i>. <li id="cite_note-447"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-447">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090910114310/http://www.statistics.gov.uk/downloads/theme_compendia/fow/WelshLanguage.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Differences in estimates of Welsh Language Skills"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Office for National Statistics. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.statistics.gov.uk/downloads/theme_compendia/fow/WelshLanguage.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 10 September 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 December</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Differences+in+estimates+of+Welsh+Language+Skills&amp;rft.pub=Office+for+National+Statistics&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.statistics.gov.uk%2Fdownloads%2Ftheme_compendia%2Ffow%2FWelshLanguage.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-Philby-469"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Philby_469-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFPhilby2012">Philby, Charlotte (12 December 2012). <a class="external text" href="https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/less-religious-and-more-ethnically-diverse-census-reveals-a-picture-of-britain-today-8406506.html" rel="nofollow">"Less religious and more ethnically diverse: Census reveals a picture of Britain today"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Independent" title="The Independent">The Independent</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-487"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-487">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/legacies/immig_emig/england/london/article_2.shtml" rel="nofollow">"East End Jews"</a>. BBC.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=East+End+Jews&amp;rft.pub=BBC&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.co.uk%2Flegacies%2Fimmig_emig%2Fengland%2Flondon%2Farticle_2.shtml&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-488"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-488">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><i>Jews in Britain: Origin and Growth of Anglo-Jewry</i>. p. 7.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Jews+in+Britain%3A+Origin+and+Growth+of+Anglo-Jewry&amp;rft.pages=7&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-506"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-506">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110716184110/http://www.ukba.homeoffice.gov.uk/workingintheuk/tier1/freshtalent/" rel="nofollow">"Fresh Talent: Working in Scotland"</a>. <li id="cite_note-Who2000-543"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Who2000_543-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHadenCampanini2000">Haden, Angela; Campanini, Barbara, eds. (2000). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/worldhealthrepor00worl" rel="nofollow"><i>The world health report 2000 – Health systems: improving performance</i></a>. Geneva: World Health Organization. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-92-4-156198-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-92-4-156198-3"><bdi>978-92-4-156198-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 July</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+world+health+report+2000+%E2%80%93+Health+systems%3A+improving+performance&amp;rft.place=Geneva&amp;rft.pub=World+Health+Organization&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.isbn=978-92-4-156198-3&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fworldhealthrepor00worl&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-544"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-544">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFWorld_Health_Organization"><a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a>. <a class="external text" href="http://pages.stern.nyu.edu/~wgreene/Statistics/WHO-COMP-Study-30.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Measuring overall health system performance for 191 countries"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite_note-545"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-545">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFFisher">Fisher, Peter. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20181120124807/http://www.healthp.org/node/71" rel="nofollow">"The NHS from Thatcher to Blair"</a>. <i>NHS Consultants Association</i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.healthp.org/node/71" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 20 November 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 December</span> 2018</span>. <q>The Budget ... was even more generous to the NHS than had been expected amounting to an annual rise of 7.4 per cent above the rate of inflation for the next five years. This would take us to 9.4 per cent of GDP spent on health ie around EU average.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=NHS+Consultants+Association&amp;rft.atitle=The+NHS+from+Thatcher+to+Blair&amp;rft.aulast=Fisher&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.healthp.org%2Fnode%2F71&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-561"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-561">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120324034938/http://www.literaturewales.org/dafydd-ap-gwilym-eng/" rel="nofollow">"Dafydd ap Gwilym"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Literature_Wales" title="Literature Wales">Academi</a> website</i>. <a href="/wiki/Literature_Wales" title="Literature Wales">Academi</a>. 2011. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.academi.org/dafydd-ap-gwilym-eng/" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 24 March 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 January</span> 2011</span>. <q>Dafydd ap Gwilym is widely regarded as one of the greatest Welsh poets of all time, and amongst the leading European poets of the Middle Ages.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Academi+website&amp;rft.atitle=Dafydd+ap+Gwilym&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.academi.org%2Fdafydd-ap-gwilym-eng%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUnited+Kingdom"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-578"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-578">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRichards2001">Richards, Jeffrey (2001). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=zSJ7zXkBc3MC&amp;pg=PA155" rel="nofollow"><i>Imperialism and Music: Britain 1876–1953</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-597"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-597">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www.allmusic.com/style/dubstep-ma0000004465" rel="nofollow">AllMusic – Dubstep</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170923151236/http://www.allmusic.com/style/dubstep-ma0000004465" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 23 September 2017 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> "Absorbed and transfigured elements of techno, drum'n' bass and dub"</span>

<li id="cite_note-MediaNewsline-634"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-MediaNewsline_634-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-MediaNewsline_634-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20101005004930/http://www.medianewsline.com/news/151/ARTICLE/4930/2009-08-13.html" rel="nofollow">"BBC: World's largest broadcaster &amp; Most trusted media brand"</a>. <li id="cite_note-654"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-654">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFScarre,_Geoffrey1995">Scarre, Geoffrey (1995). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=8A4xLnzfqYwC&amp;pg=PA82" rel="nofollow"><i>Utilitarianism</i></a>. <li><a href="/wiki/South_Georgia_and_the_South_Sandwich_Islands" title="South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands">South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Turks_and_Caicos_Islands" title="Turks and Caicos Islands">Turks and Caicos Islands</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Former colonies</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Akrotiri_and_Dhekelia" title="Akrotiri and Dhekelia">Sovereign Base Areas</a>. <sup>2</sup> Partial suspension of sovereignty due to the <a href="/wiki/Antarctic_Treaty_System" title="Antarctic Treaty System">Antarctic Treaty</a>.</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<li><a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Artsakh" title="Republic of Artsakh">Artsakh</a><sup>2</sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Northern_Cyprus" title="Northern Cyprus">Northern Cyprus</a><sup>2</sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/South_Ossetia" title="South Ossetia">South Ossetia</a><sup>2</sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Transnistria" title="Transnistria">Transnistria</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><div style="display: inline-block; line-height: 1.2em; padding: .1em 0;"><a href="/wiki/Dependent_territory" title="Dependent territory">Dependent<br/>territories</a></div></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em"></div><table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Denmark</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Faroe_Islands" title="Faroe Islands">Faroe Islands</a><sup>3</sup>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Denmark#Greenland_and_the_Faroe_Islands" title="Denmark">autonomous country of the Kingdom of Denmark</a></li></ul></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">United Kingdom</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em"></div><table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0"><tbody><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-even" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Norway</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">United Kingdom</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Northern_Ireland" title="Northern Ireland">Northern Ireland</a> (<a href="/wiki/Countries_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Countries of the United Kingdom">country of the United Kingdom</a> subject to the <a href="/wiki/Good_Friday_Agreement" title="Good Friday Agreement">British-Irish Agreement</a>)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3"><div><div class="hlist hlist-separated"><ul><li><sup>1</sup> Spans the conventional boundary between Europe and another continent.</li><li><sup>2</sup> Considered European for cultural, political and historical reasons but is geographically in Western Asia.</li><li><sup>3</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li></ul></div>
